alert.note: Alert for Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued October 22 at 10:48PM MDT until October 23 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT SUNDAY... ...HIGH WIND WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Southwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * WHERE...Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains. * WHEN...Until 6 AM MDT Sunday. Wintry weather will then arrive Sunday morning with strong to severe winds persisting through the day along with areas of blowing snow. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs may be blown down. Expect strong crosswinds on area roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Large trees that were severely burned during the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon fire will be especially susceptible to being blown down. Areas of reduced visibility in blowing snow will also be possible later Sunday.
info.instruction: Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Use extra caution.
